back_example: Natural resources are abundant in this region.
Dust tends to accumulate on surfaces over time.
The school does not have adequate funding for new equipment.
The medicine helped alleviate the patient's pain.
The instructions were ambiguous and caused confusion.
The study serves as a benchmark for future research.
The survey results may contain some cultural bias.
She presented a compelling argument for policy reform.
The report provides a comprehensive analysis of the data.
The committee reached a consensus on the new policy.
Budget constraints prevented the expansion of the project.
The decision to build a new highway was highly controversial.
Income levels correlate strongly with education attainment.
There has been a steady decline in manufacturing jobs.
Overfishing has depleted marine populations worldwide.
Air quality continues to deteriorate in major cities.
Nothing can diminish the importance of this discovery.
There is a growing disparity between urban and rural healthcare.
The city has a diverse population from many different backgrounds.
The theory is supported by empirical evidence.
Technology can enhance the learning experience for students.
Oil prices fluctuate depending on global demand.
Access to clean water is a fundamental human right.
Poor infrastructure can hinder economic development.
The researchers tested their hypothesis through a series of experiments.
The government plans to implement new environmental regulations.
Change is inevitable in a rapidly evolving society.
New legislation was introduced to protect endangered species.
Planting trees can help mitigate the effects of climate change.
The difference in test scores was negligible.
Global warming is a well-documented phenomenon.
His explanation sounded plausible but lacked evidence.
Agriculture is the predominant industry in this region.
Obesity is increasingly prevalent among young people.
The invention of the internet had a profound impact on society.
Job prospects for graduates have improved significantly.
Many companies are reluctant to adopt new technologies.
Children are often more resilient than adults expect.
The proposal came under intense public scrutiny.
There has been a significant increase in online shopping.
Modern smartphones use sophisticated facial recognition technology.
Subsequent studies confirmed the original findings.

back_subtext: Cukup besar dalam ukuran atau nilai
back_example: The company made a substantial profit last quarter.
We need to develop sustainable sources of energy.
The project has produced tangible results for the community.
The building will undergo major renovations next year.
The pandemic caused unprecedented disruption to global travel.
Bamboo is a versatile material used in construction and cooking.
Solar energy is now a commercially viable alternative.
The new farming techniques yield significantly higher crop production.

back_text: Present Perfect untuk pengalaman/hasil; Past Simple untuk waktu tertentu
back_example: I have visited Paris. (experience) vs I visited Paris in 2019. (specific time)

back_text: If + past simple, would + base verb — untuk situasi tidak nyata/hipotetis
back_example: If I had more time, I would learn another language.

back_text: Object + be + past participle — digunakan saat pelaku tidak penting atau tidak diketahui
back_example: The report was written by the research team.

back_text: Defining: tanpa koma, penting. Non-defining: dengan koma, info tambahan
back_example: The book that I read was excellent. vs My sister, who lives in Tokyo, is a doctor.

back_text: More/less + adj + than; The most/least + adj — untuk membandingkan
back_example: This method is more effective than the previous one. It is the most efficient approach.

back_text: Mengubah kalimat langsung ke tidak langsung: tense bergeser mundur
back_subtext: Melaporkan apa yang dikatakan orang lain
back_example: She said that she was planning to apply for the scholarship.

back_text: a/an = tidak spesifik; the = spesifik; zero = umum/abstrak
back_example: A student needs the right resources. Education is important. (zero article)

back_text: If + past perfect, would have + past participle — untuk situasi masa lalu yang tidak terjadi
back_subtext: Menyatakan penyesalan atau situasi hipotetis masa lalu
back_example: If I had studied harder, I would have passed the exam.

back_text: Beberapa kata kerja diikuti -ing, beberapa diikuti to + verb, beberapa keduanya
back_subtext: Memilih bentuk kata kerja yang benar
back_example: I enjoy reading. (gerund) vs I want to read. (infinitive)

back_text: It is/was + fokus + that/who — untuk menekankan bagian tertentu dari kalimat
back_example: It was the lack of funding that caused the project to fail.

back_text: Subjek tunggal = kata kerja tunggal; subjek jamak = kata kerja jamak
back_example: The number of students has increased. A number of students have enrolled.

back_text: However, Furthermore, In addition, Nevertheless, Consequently — penghubung logis
back_subtext: Menghubungkan ide antar kalimat dan paragraf
back_example: The economy grew steadily. However, unemployment remained high.

back_text: Must/might/could/can't + be/have been — untuk menduga kemungkinan
back_example: She must be tired after the long flight. He might have forgotten the meeting.

back_text: Klausa yang berfungsi sebagai subjek atau objek: What matters is... / I believe that...
back_example: What the government decides will affect everyone. I understand that this is difficult.

back_text: Not only... but also; Rarely; Seldom; Never — kata kerja bantu sebelum subjek
back_example: Not only did the project succeed, but it also exceeded expectations.

back_text: V-ing/V-ed di awal kalimat untuk mempersingkat klausa: Having finished..., Built in...
back_example: Having completed the research, the team published their findings.

back_text: Countable: a/an, many, few. Uncountable: much, little, a great deal of
back_example: There is little information available. There are few opportunities.

back_text: Wish/If only + past simple (sekarang); + past perfect (masa lalu)
back_example: I wish I spoke better English. If only I had started learning earlier.

back_text: Although + clause; Despite + noun/gerund — menyatakan kontras
back_example: Although the weather was bad, the event was successful. Despite the rain, we continued.

back_text: Will have + V3 (selesai di masa depan); Will be + V-ing (berlangsung di masa depan)
back_subtext: Tense untuk rencana dan prediksi masa depan
back_example: By 2030, the population will have reached 9 billion. This time tomorrow, I will be flying.

back_text: It seems/appears that; tends to; is likely to — bahasa yang tidak terlalu absolut
back_subtext: Menulis dengan hati-hati dalam esai akademis
back_example: This tends to suggest that early intervention is more effective.

back_text: Because of / Due to / As a result of + noun; Because / Since + clause
back_example: Due to heavy rainfall, the match was postponed. Since it rained, we stayed home.

back_text: Carry out (melakukan), bring about (menyebabkan), account for (menjelaskan)
back_subtext: Phrasal verb yang umum dalam penulisan akademis
back_example: The researchers carried out an extensive study on the topic.

back_text: Item dalam daftar harus memiliki bentuk gramatikal yang sama
back_example: She likes reading, writing, and swimming. (not: She likes reading, to write, and swim.)
I was born in 1995, on March 15th, at 3 o'clock in the morning.

front_text: Used to / Be Used to / Get Used to
back_text: Used to + V1 (kebiasaan lalu); Be used to + V-ing (terbiasa); Get used to + V-ing (menjadi terbiasa)
back_example: I used to live in Jakarta. I am used to the hot weather. I am getting used to the food.

back_text: If + past perfect, would + V1 — menghubungkan masa lalu dengan masa kini
back_example: If I had studied medicine, I would be a doctor now.

back_text: Do/Does/Did + base verb — untuk menekankan tindakan
back_example: I do believe that education is the most important factor.

back_text: Gunakan although, while, whereas, provided that untuk menghubungkan klausa dependen
back_subtext: Menulis kalimat kompleks untuk skor tinggi
back_example: While some argue that technology isolates people, others believe it connects them.

back_text: Mengubah kata kerja/adjektiva menjadi kata benda: develop → development; important → importance
back_subtext: Membuat tulisan lebih formal dan akademis
back_example: The development of new technology has led to an improvement in communication.

back_text: Baca paragraf pertama dan terakhir, serta kalimat pertama setiap paragraf untuk memahami ide utama dengan cepat
back_subtext: Gunakan 2-3 menit pertama untuk skimming sebelum menjawab pertanyaan

back_text: Cari kata kunci dari pertanyaan dalam teks — angka, nama, tanggal, atau kata khusus biasanya mudah ditemukan
back_subtext: Jangan baca seluruh teks; fokus pada kata kunci

back_text: Alokasikan 20 menit per bagian bacaan. Jangan habiskan lebih dari 2 menit per pertanyaan. Lewati yang sulit dan kembali nanti.
IELTS sering memparafrase informasi dari teks. Cari sinonim dan ungkapan alternatif, bukan kata yang persis sama.
back_subtext: Kunci untuk True/False/Not Given dan Matching

back_text: Gunakan waktu baca soal untuk memprediksi jenis jawaban (angka, nama, kata sifat). Ini membantu Anda fokus saat audio dimainkan.
Pembicara sering menyebutkan jawaban yang salah dulu, lalu mengoreksi diri. Dengarkan kata-kata seperti 'actually', 'but', 'I mean'.
back_subtext: Jawaban pertama yang Anda dengar mungkin bukan yang benar

back_text: Selalu tulis paragraf overview yang merangkum tren/fitur utama. Ini adalah kriteria penilaian penting — tanpa overview, skor akan terbatas.
Habiskan 5 menit untuk merencanakan esai: tentukan posisi, buat 2-3 poin utama, dan pikirkan contoh. Rencana yang baik = esai yang koheren.
back_subtext: Perencanaan 5 menit menghemat waktu dan meningkatkan kohesi

back_text: Campurkan kalimat sederhana, majemuk, dan kompleks. Mulai beberapa kalimat dengan frasa adverbia atau klausa dependen untuk variasi.
back_subtext: Variasi kalimat meningkatkan skor Grammatical Range

back_text: Jangan hanya jawab Ya/Tidak. Tambahkan alasan, contoh, atau detail. Targetkan 2-3 kalimat per jawaban di Part 1.
back_subtext: Jawaban singkat menunjukkan kemampuan bahasa terbatas

front_text: Speaking Part 2: Use the Cue Card Points
back_text: Cue card memiliki 3-4 poin panduan. Gunakan setiap poin sebagai paragraf mini. Ini membantu Anda berbicara selama 2 menit penuh.
back_subtext: Struktur respons Anda berdasarkan poin yang diberikan

back_text: Gunakan filler alami saat berpikir: 'Well...', 'That's an interesting question...', 'Let me think about that...' daripada diam.
back_subtext: Filler lebih baik daripada jeda panjang yang tidak nyaman

back_text: TRUE = informasi cocok. FALSE = informasi bertentangan. NOT GIVEN = informasi tidak ada dalam teks. Jangan gunakan pengetahuan umum.
back_subtext: Bedakan FALSE (bertentangan) dari NOT GIVEN (tidak disebutkan)

back_text: Task 1: minimal 150 kata. Task 2: minimal 250 kata. Menulis kurang dari minimum akan menurunkan skor. Targetkan 170+ dan 270+ kata.
back_subtext: Hitung kata Anda sebelum waktu habis

back_text: Jawaban Listening harus dieja dengan benar. Perhatikan plural (s), double letters, dan ejaan British vs American (keduanya diterima).
Tunjukkan kemampuan diskusi: pertimbangkan kedua sisi, gunakan 'On the one hand... on the other hand...' dan berikan pendapat pribadi di akhir.
Jangan gunakan kontraksi (don't → do not), slang, atau bahasa percakapan dalam esai. Gunakan register formal dan akademis.
back_subtext: Bahasa informal menurunkan skor Lexical Resource

back_text: Baca paragraf dan cari ide utama, bukan detail. Hapus heading yang sudah digunakan. Mulai dari paragraf yang paling jelas.
back_subtext: Fokus pada ide utama, bukan kata kunci individu

back_text: Tidak ada penalti untuk jawaban salah di IELTS. Selalu isi semua jawaban, bahkan jika Anda harus menebak. Jawaban kosong = pasti salah.
back_subtext: Tebakan memiliki peluang benar; kosong tidak

back_text: Sisakan 2-3 menit di akhir untuk memeriksa ejaan, tata bahasa, dan kelengkapan jawaban. Kesalahan kecil yang diperbaiki bisa menaikkan skor.
back_subtext: Cek cepat bisa menyelamatkan poin berharga

back_example: The professor discussed abstract concepts of justice and morality.
Language acquisition occurs naturally in young children.
Environmental groups advocate for stricter pollution controls.
The human brain is often considered analogous to a computer.

back_subtext: Studi tentang masyarakat dan budaya manusia
back_example: She is majoring in anthropology and studies indigenous cultures.
The assignment of students to groups seemed arbitrary.
Teachers use various methods to assess student performance.

back_subtext: Menghubungkan sesuatu ke penyebab; ciri khas
back_example: Scientists attribute the warming trend to greenhouse gas emissions.
The university operates as an autonomous institution.
The discovery acted as a catalyst for further research.
The events are presented in chronological order.
Cognitive development in children follows predictable stages.
The student presented a coherent argument in her essay.
The committee comprises twelve members from different departments.
It is difficult to conceive of a world without the internet.
The two events were concurrent and attracted large audiences.
The theory has generated considerable controversy among experts.
The main criterion for selection is academic achievement.
Demographic changes have affected the housing market significantly.
Many English words are derived from Latin and Greek roots.

back_subtext: Perbedaan antara hal-hal yang seharusnya sama
back_example: There is a discrepancy between the two sets of data.
The internet has made it easier to disseminate information globally.
Coral reefs are among the most diverse ecosystems on Earth.
Could you elaborate on your research methodology?
The professor used questions to elicit responses from the students.
Soil erosion is a major environmental concern in agricultural regions.

back_subtext: Bagian yang diambil dari teks yang lebih panjang
back_example: The professor read an excerpt from the original research paper.
The instructions were explicit and left no room for confusion.
The plan seems feasible given the available resources.
The scientist formulated a new hypothesis based on the data.
In many organizations, there is a clear hierarchy of authority.
The findings have important implications for public health policy.

back_subtext: Berasal dari tempat tertentu secara alami
back_example: The lecture focused on indigenous peoples and their cultural practices.
There are inherent risks in any scientific experiment.
Technological innovation has transformed the way we communicate.
The course integrates theory with practical application.

back_subtext: Sistem metode yang digunakan dalam penelitian
back_example: The researcher explained the methodology used in the experiment.
Understanding the nuances of academic writing takes practice.
The discovery led to a paradigm shift in the field of biology.

back_subtext: Melihat atau memahami dengan cara tertentu
back_example: People perceive risk differently depending on their experiences.
The preliminary results suggest that the treatment is effective.
Social media platforms have proliferated over the past decade.
The professor explained the rationale behind the new curriculum.
The lecturer refuted the claims made in the reading passage.
The politician's speech was full of powerful rhetoric.
Computer models can simulate the effects of climate change.
Students must synthesize information from multiple sources in their essays.
The thesis of the essay is that education reduces inequality.
Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.
Further experiments are needed to validate these findings.

back_text: Apositif: frasa benda yang menjelaskan benda lain — diapit koma
back_example: Dr. Lee, a renowned biologist, presented her findings at the conference.

back_text: Gunakan base verb setelah suggest, recommend, insist, demand + that
back_example: The committee recommended that the student submit the application early.

back_text: Klausa adjektiva bisa dipersingkat: who is → dihilangkan; which was built → built
back_example: The book written by the professor (= which was written) is a bestseller.

back_text: Both...and, Either...or, Neither...nor, Not only...but also — selalu berpasangan
back_example: Not only did the study confirm the hypothesis, but it also revealed new patterns.

back_text: Because / Since / As / Given that + clause — menjelaskan alasan
back_example: Since the data was inconclusive, further research is necessary.

back_text: To have + past participle — merujuk pada tindakan sebelum waktu utama
back_example: The species appears to have evolved independently on each island.

back_text: Modifier harus jelas merujuk ke subjek kalimat — jika tidak, itu 'dangling'
back_subtext: Kesalahan umum yang diuji di TOEFL
back_example: Wrong: Walking to class, the rain started. Correct: Walking to class, I got caught in the rain.

back_text: In contrast, Similarly, Moreover, As a result, In other words — penghubung antar kalimat
back_example: The first study found no correlation. In contrast, the second study showed a strong link.

back_text: Pronoun harus jelas merujuk ke satu anteseden dan setuju dalam jumlah dan gender
back_example: Each student must submit their assignment on time. (singular they is accepted)

back_text: Urutan: opinion → size → age → shape → color → origin → material → purpose
back_example: She bought a beautiful large old rectangular brown French wooden writing desk.

back_text: Had + past participle — untuk peristiwa yang terjadi sebelum peristiwa lain di masa lalu
back_example: By the time the researchers arrived, the volcano had already erupted.

back_text: Pertanyaan dalam kalimat: gunakan urutan subjek-verb (bukan inversi pertanyaan)
back_example: I wonder what the professor meant by that statement. (not: what did the professor mean)

back_text: If + present simple, will + base verb — untuk situasi nyata di masa depan
back_example: If the temperature rises, the ice caps will melt faster.

back_text: Menghilangkan kata yang diulang dalam perbandingan: She runs faster than he (does).
back_example: Urban areas produce more pollution than rural ones (do).

back_text: Many/few + countable; much/little + uncountable; some/a lot of + keduanya
back_example: There is a great deal of research on this topic but few conclusive studies.

back_text: It is believed/said/thought that... — untuk melaporkan pendapat umum secara formal
back_example: It is widely believed that exercise improves mental health.

back_text: Kalimat lengkap harus memiliki subjek dan predikat. Fragment = kalimat tidak lengkap.
back_example: Wrong: Because the experiment failed. Correct: The team was disappointed because the experiment failed.

back_text: Dua klausa independen tidak bisa digabungkan hanya dengan koma. Gunakan titik, semicolon, atau conjunction.
back_example: Wrong: The results were surprising, they changed our understanding. Correct: The results were surprising; they changed our understanding.

back_text: Restrictive (that): informasi penting. Non-restrictive (which + koma): informasi tambahan.
back_subtext: That vs which dalam penulisan formal
back_example: The study that was published last year (essential) vs The study, which was published last year, (extra info)

back_text: Make: a decision, progress, an effort, a mistake. Do: research, harm, an experiment, business.
back_example: The team made significant progress and did extensive research.

back_text: The + comparative, the + comparative — semakin..., semakin...
back_example: The more you practice, the better your speaking skills become.

back_text: Adverbia frekuensi: sebelum kata kerja utama, setelah be. Adverbia cara: biasanya di akhir.
back_example: She has always been interested in science. He spoke clearly and confidently.

back_text: It is + adj + to/that — 'It' sebagai subjek sementara untuk kalimat impersonal
back_example: It is essential to understand the methodology before analyzing results.

back_text: Depend on, result in, account for, consist of, refer to — preposisi yang tetap
back_subtext: Preposisi yang mengikuti kata kerja tertentu
back_example: The outcome depends on several environmental factors.

back_text: Gabungan kalimat majemuk dan kompleks: 2+ klausa independen + 1+ klausa dependen
back_example: Although the study was small, the results were promising, and they inspired further research.

back_text: To + verb / In order to + verb — menyatakan tujuan suatu tindakan
back_example: Researchers conducted the study to determine the effects of the new drug.

back_text: Letakkan frasa keterangan di awal kalimat untuk variasi: In recent years, ... / According to ...,
back_example: In recent decades, the global population has grown significantly.

back_text: Where (tempat), when (waktu), why (alasan) — menggantikan in which, at which, for which
back_example: The era when dinosaurs roamed the Earth lasted millions of years.

back_text: Stative (know, believe, own) biasanya tidak digunakan dalam continuous. Dynamic (run, write) bisa.
back_subtext: Mengapa beberapa kata kerja tidak menggunakan -ing
back_example: I know the answer. (not: I am knowing) vs I am writing an essay. (dynamic)

back_text: May, might, could + verb — menurunkan kepastian pernyataan dalam penulisan akademis
back_example: This finding may suggest that environmental factors play a role. Further research could clarify this.

back_text: Jangan bergantung pada arti kata yang Anda hafal. Baca kalimat sekitar kata tersebut untuk memahami makna kontekstualnya.
back_subtext: TOEFL sering menguji makna sekunder kata

back_text: Untuk pertanyaan inferensi, cari bukti langsung dalam teks. Jawaban yang benar harus didukung oleh informasi dalam paragraf, bukan asumsi.
back_subtext: Inferensi = kesimpulan logis dari fakta, bukan tebakan

back_text: Untuk pertanyaan ringkasan, pilih opsi yang mewakili ide utama, bukan detail kecil. Detail kecil biasanya jawaban yang salah.
Catat kata kunci, bukan kalimat lengkap. Gunakan singkatan dan simbol. Fokus pada ide utama, contoh, dan penjelasan profesor.
Perhatikan nada suara pembicara dan frasa seperti 'Actually...', 'Well, you see...' untuk memahami tujuan dan sikap.
back_subtext: Nada dan konteks sama pentingnya dengan kata-kata

back_text: Dengarkan sinyal struktur: 'Today we'll discuss...', 'The main point is...', 'Let me give you an example...' untuk mengikuti alur.
Gunakan 15 detik persiapan untuk memilih posisi dan memikirkan 2 alasan + contoh. Jangan mengganti posisi di tengah jalan.
back_subtext: Jawaban terstruktur > jawaban panjang tanpa arah

back_text: Gunakan template: 'The reading states... The professor discusses... He/She argues that...' untuk mengorganisir respons terintegrasi.
Intro: parafrase topik. Body 1-3: setiap paragraf = 1 poin bacaan + bantahan dosen. Conclusion: ringkasan singkat.
Pilih satu sisi dan pertahankan. Gunakan 4-5 paragraf: intro + 2-3 body + conclusion. Targetkan 300+ kata untuk skor tinggi.
back_subtext: Konsistensi posisi lebih penting daripada keseimbangan

back_text: Cari kata penghubung (however, this, such) dalam kalimat yang akan disisipkan. Kata ini harus terhubung logis dengan kalimat sebelumnya.
back_subtext: Perhatikan referensi pronoun dan kata transisi

back_text: Reading: 54-72 min. Listening: 41-57 min. Speaking: 17 min. Writing: 50 min. Jangan terlalu lama di satu pertanyaan.
Eliminasi jawaban yang: terlalu ekstrem (always, never), tidak disebutkan dalam teks, atau bertentangan dengan isi teks.
Jeda panjang menurunkan skor fluency. Gunakan filler akademis: 'In my experience...', 'I think this is important because...'
Contoh spesifik lebih kuat dari pernyataan umum. Sebutkan nama, tempat, angka, atau pengalaman pribadi yang relevan.
Pertanyaan pertama biasanya tentang ide utama. Jawab berdasarkan tema keseluruhan, bukan detail tunggal.
back_subtext: Ide utama = apa yang ingin disampaikan pembicara

back_text: Sisakan 3-5 menit untuk memeriksa: subject-verb agreement, artikel, ejaan, dan tense consistency.
Gunakan kata transisi: First, Second, For example, In contrast, To summarize — ini menunjukkan organisasi pikiran yang baik.
back_subtext: Organisasi yang jelas = skor lebih tinggi

back_text: Tanyakan: 'Mengapa penulis menyebutkan ini?' Biasanya untuk: memberi contoh, membandingkan, mendukung argumen, atau menentang ide.
TOEFL berlangsung 3+ jam. Latihan mengerjakan tes penuh dalam satu sesi untuk membangun stamina mental dan konsentrasi.
back_subtext: Simulasi tes penuh minimal 2x sebelum ujian
